wikipedia_page.main:
Kevin J Maclean (born 5 February 1994 in Dunfermline, Scotland) is a Scottish singer-songwriter also known as "K.J.M."
Maclean started at a young age recording at music studios all over Scotland and recording most of his material at REC Music Studios with record producer Gus Black.  He was signed to Scottish indie label Plaque Records until May 2009.
In 2006, Maclean won a competition for best songwriter in Perthshire. Maclean has performed/ headlined in some of Scotland's best venues including The Liquid Rooms & Bongo Club in Edinburgh, King Tut's Wah Wah Hut in Glasgow, and Fat Sams in Dundee.
Maclean suffers from severe asthma attacks and works with Asthma UK Scotland to raise awareness.
